ygData.subject: stacked-songs
ygData.msgSnippet: I just banged this out, its a simple 50x50 chart of songs and if they stack (blue block) or not (red block).  I did 1-10 because its late, but any info you can
ygData.messageBody:
I just banged this out, its a simple 50x50 chart of songs and if they stack
(blue block) or not (red block). I did 1-10 because its late, but any info
you can pass along would be great. The URL will give you a zipped excel
file (its 5 kB in size - I made the not-unreasonable assumption that if
you're playing EQ you've got access to the Office suite). I will convert it
to HTML when its finished since I refuse to use FrontPage or another MS html
tool. Try it: saving the exact same file via excel's horrible toHTML
converter resulted in a 872 kB file.

http://www.erols.com/gww6e/stacked-songs.zip

I have a grandiose idea that it could also incorporate the best song to
twist with and the third voice to weave in as well should you feel inclined.
Obviously this changes with level, so an idea would be to have a simple
javascript or layer thingy that when you clicked on the diagonal the
appropriate dancing partners where illuminated, but that's a ways off since
the chart isn't even complete. :)

Lastly, I'm trying to think of a cute little name for it all. Ideas so far
include Tuning Chart, Transposed Chart, Setlist, Playlist, The EQ Top 50.

Thanks all.
